page.title: 14 BIRDS AROUND TILMANSTONE
page.content: 1985 saw approximately 40 resident species, The{garden birds}included Blackbirds, Sparrows, Finches, Starlings, Linnets.{Field birds}were Partridges, Pheasants, Lapwings, Owls, Doves, and Yellowhammers. In{woodland were Wrens, Goldcrests, Tits, Night_ ingales, Woodpeckers, Nuthatches, Jays and Crows; and birds of prey. Some 45 species are{visitors}or{ {passage migrants.}This area is well_ favoured for visiting birds, some stay for a{season,}others are on their way to{summer}or{winter homes.}Swifts, Swallows and Martins are common in summer; the Golden Oriole is less numerous but one species which is increasing. The variety of{habitat,}woodland, cultivated fields, hedgerows, meadow_ land and gardens provide{food}and {shelter}suited to birds of many types.
